content: POLICY ALERT: Cross-Plan Validation. The system will now auto-reject any attempt to enroll in the 'High Deductible' plan if the user has an active 'Standard FSA' balance. Users must spend down the FSA balance to $0 before the effective date to proceed.

User [ID_PLACEHOLDER] submitted a 'Life Event' request 45 days after the event date. They claim they were traveling internationally and couldn't access the portal. Can we grant an exception to the 30-day window?

Denied. The 30-day window is a strict compliance requirement. Travel does not qualify as an exception. They must wait for the next Open Enrollment period unless they experience another qualifying event.
I'm reviewing a verification upload for User [ID_PLACEHOLDER]. They provided a lease agreement from last month to prove domestic partnership. Is this sufficient to clear the hold?

Insufficient. The policy requires proof of shared residence for at least 6 months prior to the application. A lease from last month does not meet the duration requirement. Request a bank statement or utility bill dated 6+ months ago.

Reimbursement Update: The annual $[AMOUNT] stipend covers services (gym, classes, subscriptions) but explicitly excludes tangible goods (equipment, apparel, hardware). Any claims for physical items will be auto-rejected.

Plan Definition Update: 'Adult Orthodontia' is now an exclusive benefit of the 'Platinum' tier. The 'Gold' and 'Silver' tiers are restricted to pediatric coverage only (under age 19). Please update your scripts.
